definition: great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
a sense of having been through good times and bad/a weathered and worn look

sentences.english: It was like an old man and had seen all kinds of departure.
sentences.chinese: 它就像个历经沧桑的老人，亲历过各种离愁别绪。

sentences.english: Hill with thick, which has the final calendar vicissitudes.
sentences.chinese: 山以其厚重，历沧桑而为之雄浑。

sentences.english: She has a long history, but also changes everyday.
sentences.chinese: 又有历史的沧桑感，但是又在日新月异的变化。

sentences.english: He'd had a chequered past but was now determined to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 他过去饱经沧桑，但现在决心要干一番成就。

sentences.english: The statues of former navy generals stand rock-firm, silently observing Weihai's tremendous changes.
sentences.chinese: 海军将领的雕像昂然屹立，静观着威海的沧桑巨变。

sentences.english: Look at these dreams so beaten and so battered.
sentences.chinese: 看看这些历尽沧桑的梦想。

sentences.english: She has buffeted about from pillar to post for ten years.
What a feeling of vicissitudes of history?
In the time of old youth, as the years of vicissitudes of life together.
sentences.chinese: 在时光中老去的青春，随着岁月一起沧桑。

sentences.english: We've been through a lot but we're still together. It must be fate.
sentences.chinese: 我们历尽沧桑后仍然在一起，必定是命中注定的。

sentences.english: One time of vicissitudes, a solemn and stirring story.
sentences.chinese: 一个沧桑的年代，一个悲壮的故事。

sentences.english: Years of vicissitudes, cutting ax moment miraculously imprinted on her face.
sentences.chinese: 岁月的沧桑，刀削斧刻般地深深印在她的脸上。

sentences.english: Endless vicissitudes in the flowers would not have forever.
sentences.chinese: 不尽的沧桑里不会有永远的花团锦簇。

sentences.english: Go through vicissitudes of life , your needing to learn to ignore over.
sentences.chinese: 历尽沧桑，你要学会忽略过去。

sentences.english: No wonder this place makes me feel a sense of history.
sentences.chinese: 你别说，这里真的有一点儿历史的沧桑感。

definition: to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
a sense of having been through good times and bad/a weathered and worn look
weather-beaten/having experienced the hardships of life
